channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why Trump Media is getting into the nuclear business with $6 billion TAE deal
item.description: Trump Media’s stock is soaring as the Truth Social operator looks to get in on a hot AI power trend.

item.title: From on-device AI to the ‘girlfriend index,’ trading ideas from the research firm that nailed 2025’s investment themes
item.description: Citrini Research nailed many investment themes for 2025. Here are a handful of ideas they see delivering potential in 2026.

item.title: Fear of losing your job is no way to get employees on board with AI
item.description: Companies want workers to embrace AI — but a hardline ultimatum will backfire

item.title: Flu season is ‘early’ and ‘aggressive’ in New York City. Here’s what that means for the rest of the country.
item.description: A new variant called H3N2 subclade K is causing most of the illness this season

item.title: The next year will be for stock picking — and the next two weeks should see gains, says Goldman Sachs
item.description: One interpretation of options market pricing by Goldman Sachs, says stocks won’t be tugging the same way next year.

item.title: Thursday's big stock stories: What’s likely to move the market in the next trading session
item.description: A selloff in Oracle and other tech names dragged the S&P 500 to a fourth straight losing session on Wednesday.

item.title: Buy this EV maker ahead of its AI-enabled vehicle rollout next year, says Baird
item.description: The investment firm upgraded the stock to outperform from neutral.

item.title: Micron gets an upgrade from Bank of America after blowout quarter and guidance
item.description: Analyst Vivek Arya upgraded the memory chipmaker to buy from neutral.

item.title: Buy the dip on Core Scientific as 2026 approaches, says Citizens
item.description: Citizens raised its price target and stock rating for Core Scientific, arguing the firm is "undervalued."

item.title: This communication services ETF could be on the verge of a breakout, charts show
item.description: A bullish chart pattern has been forming for the State Street Communication Services Select Sector SPDR ETF (XLC).
